original_title: Microsoft BASIC For the Dragon 64 Recovered
original_content:
There are a great many pieces of software of yesteryear that are no longer readily accessible. Its now possible to cross Microsoft BASIC for the Dragon 64 off that list, with the source code now posted for all to enjoy on GitHub.
The repository concerns the Microsoft 16K BASIC Interpreter as built for the Motorola 6809, as used in the Dragon 64 computer. This is also known as BASIC-69 or Extended Color Basic.
Hilariously, the source code was recovered from 340 pages of fan-fold tractor paper stored in four bundles. The output of a Motorola assembler was printed back in 1983 at Dragon Datas RD facility in Wales, and was recently recovered after being stored in an attic for much of the last four decades. The paper was carefully scanned at the 2022 Dragon Meetup, before passing the resulting images through OCR software. The output was then manually corrected and the source code was complete for both the 32K and 64K mode ROMs. There are some differences between the scanned source and what Microsoft shipped, which is outlined in the repository.
Weve seen other heroic retrocomputer recovery efforts before, too, like the work to save the Polish CROOK OS. If youve been working on similar feats, be sure to let us know.
title: ドラゴン64用のMicrosoft BASICのソースコードがGitHubに公開されました
body: MS BASIC for Dragon 64のソースコードがGitHubに公開されました。1983年のファンフォールド紙から取り戻されたもので、OCRソフトウェアを通した後、修正されました。他の類似の取り組みもあるようです。
titles: ドラゴン64用のMicrosoft BASICのソースコードがGitHubに公開されました
ドラゴン64コンピュータ向けのMicrosoft 16K BASIC Interpreterのソースコードが復元されました
ドラゴン64 BASIC-69のソースコードが見つかりました
40年以上の間、屋根裏に保管されていたドラゴン64 BASICのソースコードが公開されました
OCRソフトウェアを使用して復元されたドラゴン64 BASICのソースコードが利用可能になりました
